title: Regional Assistant Finance Managers / Senior Finance Analysts
content:
About Ogilvy
Ogilvy was founded in 1948 by David Ogilvy. David created a culture that deeply respects and cares about its people and clients. Our mission is to inspire people and brands to make an impact and we are committed to attracting, growing, and retaining the best talent in the industry. 
About the Role  
We are looking for a suitable candidate to join our Asia Pacific Regional Finance Team based in Hong Kong
What You’ll Do 
· Handle monthly closing of regional books and review monthly group reporting package
· Compile SOX reports and group reporting schedules with sensible variance explanation in a timely manner
· Manage cost allocations and intercompany transactions for Asia Pacific markets including PO/invoice, reconciliation and variance explanations
· Liaise with service center for account payables and payment cycle.
· Assist / Participate annual budget/ quarterly forecast and relevant schedules
· Ensure compliance of accounting/group policies, internal control guidance, tax, audit and other statutory requirements
· Assist in developing and reviewing internal compliance procedures
· Independently handle statutory audit and tax filing
· Identify and resolve accounting and taxation issues
· Perform ad hoc assignments assigned by supervisors
 
What You’ll Need  
· Degree in Accounting
· Qualified accountant
· Minimum 7 years of practical experience in multinational/listed company
· Hands-on experience in month end closing
· Audit experience is a must plus solid knowledge of Hong Kong Accounting Standards and regulations
· Strong problem-solving skills plus flexible mindset are essentials
· Team player with good communication skills to work well with different counterparties
· Able to work under pressure and manage multiple assignments
· Be proactive, detail-minded, multitasking and able to work independently
· Hardworking and willing to work overtime to meet reporting deadlines
· Effective time management & able to prioritize tasks
· Excellent command of written, spoken English and Chinese
· Less experience will be considered as Senior Finance Analyst
· Immediate available is highly preferred
· Interested parties please apply with full resume stating current and expected salary.
How We’ll Support You 
Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.  


At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
